alert.note: Alert for Fulton (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 11:44PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Fulton County through 1215 AM CDT... At 1143 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Vermont, or 14 miles west of Lewistown, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Ipava around 1155 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Lewistown, Cuba and St. David. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
